issues.description: The UML in the problem statement declares Ride::getName() with return type char[] but the Ride attribute 'name' is of type String (and the solution implements getName() returning String). This internal contradiction in the problem statement (method return type vs. attribute type) will confuse students about the correct getter signature and cause implementations to mismatch the reference solution/tests.
issues.suggested_fix: Correct the UML / problem statement so the getter return type matches the attribute type. Change the UML entry '+getName(): char[]' to '+getName(): String' (and/or explicitly include '+getAbbreviation(): char' as a getter) so students implement getName() returning String and avoid mismatches with the provided solution/tests.
